title: Interactive Playgrounds
description: First out in our interaction design course was explorative design. We were supposed to conceptualize ways to make playgrounds interactive. At the end of the project we presented 3 radically different ideas ranging from a modified seesaw to an interactive light trail. Take a look at the posters below to get an idea of the different concepts.
reflection: This was the first time I used PLEX cards and it turned out to bring out some funky ideas. It would be cool to further develop and try one of the games in practice.
process: We used PLEX cards to help in our initial ideation phase, we later refined the ideas and fleshed out posters for presentation.
information: This was the first part in the Interaction Design 2 couse at KTH. The area was explorative design and I worked together with Ida Vainionpää to design 3 different playground ideas and present them as posters. I was in charge of digitalizing the posters, we designed them together by hand, and I took them through Photoshop.
